The group reassesses control over an investee when changes occur in the elements of control.
An investee is consolidated when control is obtained.
All assets and liabilities related to transactions between Group entities are derecognized when consolidated.
Changes in interests in a subsidiary that do not result in loss of control are accounted for in Equity.
When control is lost, all related assets, liabilities, and non-controlling interests are derecognized.
Business combinations are accounted for using the acquisition method.
Acquisition cost is the fair value of consideration transferred plus any non-controlling interest.
Goodwill is measured at cost, which is the excess of consideration paid over net identifiable assets.
Goodwill is allocated to cash-generating units for impairment testing.

elements.title: Associates and Translation criteria of foreign currency financial statements

data.value: Associates are those companies in which the Group has significant influence, but over which it does not exercise management control. Significant influence is presumed to apply when the Group holds 20% to 50% of voting rights at Shareholders’ Meetings.
Investments in associates are measured at equity.
The Group’s share of associates’ post-acquisition profits or losses is recognised in the Income Statement.

Unrealized profits relating to transactions between the Group and its associates are derecognised in proportion to the Group’s interests. Unrealized losses are derecognised unless considered impairment.

Financial statements prepared in currencies other than the Euro are consolidated using the method described, subject to translation into Euro. Assets and liabilities are translated using the closing rate, costs and revenue are translated at the average annual rate.
Classified when the relationship with the hedged item is documented and effectiveness is high.
Designated against variability in cash flows affecting the Income Statement.
Measured at lower of cost and net realisable value.
Book value recovered primarily through sale rather than continued use.
Completion planned within one year from classification.

elements.title: Provisions for Risks and Charges and Employee Benefits Assessment

data.value: This section discusses actuarial calculation methods used in determining obligations related to defined-benefit plans and other long-term employee benefits.
The actuarial calculation relies on objective demographic and financial assumptions.
Obligation is recorded net of the fair value of plan assets.
Revaluations are recognized immediately in the financial position and not reclassified in subsequent income statements.
Provisions are made for uncertain liabilities under specific conditions.
Recognized if there's an implied obligation and a formal plan is in place.

elements.title: Share-based incentive plan - Equity-settled payment transactions

data.value: A number of Group employees receive part of the remuneration as share-based payments, providing services in exchange for shares.
The cost is determined by fair value on the assignment date and recognized under labor costs.
Cumulative costs recorded up to the vesting date are commensurate with the expiry of the vesting period.
Non-vesting conditions are reflected in the fair value and may result in immediate cost recognition.
When rights include market conditions, they are treated as vested regardless of whether conditions are met.
Any change that results in an increase in total fair value is recognized based on the date of change.
If a plan is cancelled, any remaining fair value is transferred to the income statement.
Includes current and deferred tax, generally charged to the Income Statement.

data.value: This actuarial calculation method requires the use of objective, and mutually compatible actuarial assumptions on demographic (mortality rate, staff turnover rate) and financial (discount rate, future increases in salary and benefit levels) variables.
When a defined-benefit plan is entirely or partly financed by contributions paid to a fund, legally separate from the company, or to an insurance company, the plan assets are measured at fair value.

Revaluations, which include actuarial gains and losses, changes in the effect of the asset ceiling (excluding net interest), and the return on plan assets (excluding net interest), are recognised immediately in the Statement of Financial Position by debiting or crediting retained earnings.
Other long-term benefits are employee benefits other than post-employment benefits. Accounting is similar to defined-benefit plans.
Provisions for risks and charges are set aside to cover liabilities of uncertain amount or due date that must be recognised in the financial statements.
If the effect of discounting the value of money is significant, allocations are determined by discounting expected future cash flows at a pre-tax discount rate.
The Company recognises restructuring provisions if there is an implied obligation to restructure and there is a formal plan for restructuring.

data.value: Higher payments to suppliers due to cost inflation and increased average inventory volumes, especially in the first part of the year, caused by shortages.

This table appears to be a depreciation rate schedule for various categories of assets. It is divided into three main categories: Property, Plant and equipment, and Other assets. The rates vary significantly across asset types, with Land having 0% depreciation, while some electronic equipment has rates as high as 33%. Most industrial equipment falls in the 10-20% range, while buildings have much lower rates at 2-3.3%. This suggests a standard corporate depreciation policy that reflects the different useful lives of various asset categories.

data.value: For short-term and low-value lease contracts, financial liabilities related to the leases are not recognised.
Lease payments are recognised in the income statement on a straight-line basis for the duration of the contracts.
Rights of use are shown in a specific item of the financial statements.
Right of use is recognised at a value corresponding to the lease payable.
Right of use is depreciated on a straight-line basis.
Lease payables are shown under current and non-current financial liabilities.
Lease payable is recorded on the basis of the present value of the lease instalments.
Present value is determined using the incremental borrowing rate if the implicit interest rate is not indicated.
Lease payable is restated in the event of changes to the contracts or other situations.

elements.title: Derecognition of Financial Assets and Liabilities

data.value: Financial assets are derecognised when the right to receive cash ceases, the Group transfers the right to receive cash flows, or assumes obligations to pay them in full.
The Group assesses if it has transferred essentially all risks and benefits or retains control of the asset.
Regular valuations are conducted for objective evidence of impairment of financial assets, costs recognized in income statement.
Simplified calculation of expected losses for trade receivables and contract assets; full recognition at each reporting date.
Established based on historical information and the economic environment of debtors.
Measured using amortised cost method, effective interest rate method for income statement.
Financial liabilities for trading or designated at fair value through profit or loss are measured at fair value.
Initially recognised at fair value, increased by attributable costs, measured at higher of estimate or initially recognised amount.
Removed when the underlying obligation is discharged, cancelled, or satisfied.
Exchange of financial liability on substantially different terms treated as derecognition and recognition of new liability.
Recognised in the income statement for irrelevant financial liability amendments.
Financial asset and liability can be offset if there is a legal right and intention to settle net amounts.

A simplified approach calculates expected losses and is fully recognised at each reporting date.
Financial liabilities are measured using the amortised cost method and financial guarantees are recognised at fair value.
A financial liability is removed when the obligation is discharged, cancelled, or satisfied.

elements.title: Annual Statutory Financial Report at December 31, 2022

data.value: A financial asset and liability can be offset and the net balance can be shown in the Statement of Financial Position if there is a current legal right to offset the amounts recognised and there is the intention to settle the net remainder, or realize the asset and at the same time settle the liability.

Derivatives, including embedded derivatives, separate from the main contract, are initially recognised at fair value. Derivatives are classified as hedging instruments when the relationship between the derivative and the hedged item is formally documented and the effectiveness of the hedge, assessed periodically, is high.

data.key: Non-current assets held for sale and discontinued operations
data.value: The Company classifies non-current assets held for sale as held for sale if their book value will be recovered primarily through a sale transaction, rather than through their continued use. These non-current assets held for sale classified as held for sale are measured at the lower of their book value and their fair value less costs to sell.
Recognised against all deductible temporary differences and unused tax receivables and losses carried forward.
Measured at fair value, shown net of VAT, discounts, and rebates.

- Identification and understanding of key controls implemented by Management over the computation of the above adjustments to revenue and test of the related operating effectiveness; - Analysis of the reasonableness of Managements’ main assumptions used to estimate the adjustments to revenues; - Performance of analytical and substantive procedures in order to verify the accuracy and completeness of the data used by Management; - Analysis of the main sales agreements in place, in order to ascertain that the relevant terms and clauses have been taken into account by Management in determining the adjustments to revenues; - Performance of analytical review procedures comparing historical data related to actual returns and discounts and the estimates made by Management.
